segment.source: Refresh an AppLocker policy (Windows 10)
segment.target: Refresh an AppLocker policy (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps to force an update for an AppLocker policy.
segment.target: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps to force an update for an AppLocker policy.

segment.source: Refresh an AppLocker policy
segment.target: Refresh an AppLocker policy

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps to force an update for an AppLocker policy.
segment.target: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps to force an update for an AppLocker policy.

segment.source: If you update the rule collection on a local computer by using the Local Security Policy snap-in, the policy will take effect immediately.
segment.target: If you update the rule collection on a local computer by using the Local Security Policy snap-in, the policy will take effect immediately.

segment.source: If Group Policy is used to distribute the AppLocker policy and you want to immediately implement the policy, you must manually refresh the policy.
segment.target: If Group Policy is used to distribute the AppLocker policy and you want to immediately implement the policy, you must manually refresh the policy.

segment.source: The Group Policy refresh might take several minutes, depending upon the number of policies within the Group Policy Object (GPO) and the number of target computers.
segment.target: The Group Policy refresh might take several minutes, depending upon the number of policies within the Group Policy Object (GPO) and the number of target computers.

segment.source: To use Group Policy to distribute the AppLocker policy change, you need to retrieve the deployed AppLocker policy first.
segment.target: To use Group Policy to distribute the AppLocker policy change, you need to retrieve the deployed AppLocker policy first.

segment.source: To prepare for the update and subsequent refresh, see Edit an AppLocker policy
segment.target: To prepare for the update and subsequent refresh, see Edit an AppLocker policy

segment.source: Edit an AppLocker policy and Use the AppLocker Windows PowerShell cmdlets.
segment.target: Edit an AppLocker policy and Use the AppLocker Windows PowerShell cmdlets.

segment.source: To complete this procedure, you must have Edit Setting permission to edit a GPO.
segment.target: To complete this procedure, you must have Edit Setting permission to edit a GPO.

segment.source: By default, members of the Domain Admins group, the Enterprise Admins group, and the Group Policy Creator Owners group have this permission.
segment.target: By default, members of the Domain Admins group, the Enterprise Admins group, and the Group Policy Creator Owners group have this permission.

segment.source: To manually refresh the AppLocker policy by using Group Policy
segment.target: To manually refresh the AppLocker policy by using Group Policy

segment.source: From a command prompt, type gpupdate /force, and then press ENTER.
segment.target: From a command prompt, type gpupdate /force, and then press ENTER.

segment.source: When the command finishes, close the command prompt window, and then verify that the intended rule behavior is correct.
segment.target: When the command finishes, close the command prompt window, and then verify that the intended rule behavior is correct.

segment.source: You can do this by checking the AppLocker event logs for events that include "policy applied."
segment.target: You can do this by checking the AppLocker event logs for events that include "policy applied."

segment.source: To change a policy on an individual computer, or to implement that policy on other computers, without using Group Policy, you first need to update the rule within the rule collection.
segment.target: To change a policy on an individual computer, or to implement that policy on other computers, without using Group Policy, you first need to update the rule within the rule collection.

segment.source: For information about updating existing rules, see Edit AppLocker rules.
segment.target: For information about updating existing rules, see Edit AppLocker rules.

segment.source: For information about creating a new rule for an existing policy, see:
segment.target: For information about creating a new rule for an existing policy, see:

segment.source: Create a rule that uses a publisher condition
segment.target: Create a rule that uses a publisher condition

segment.source: Create a rule that uses a file hash condition
segment.target: Create a rule that uses a file hash condition

segment.source: Create a rule that uses a path condition
segment.target: Create a rule that uses a path condition

segment.source: Membership in the local Administrators group, or equivalent, is the minimum required to complete this procedure.
segment.target: Membership in the local Administrators group, or equivalent, is the minimum required to complete this procedure.

segment.source: To refresh the AppLocker policy on the local computer
segment.target: To refresh the AppLocker policy on the local computer

segment.source: Update the rule collection by using the Local Security Policy console with one of the following procedures:
segment.target: Update the rule collection by using the Local Security Policy console with one of the following procedures:

segment.source: Edit AppLocker rules
segment.target: Edit AppLocker rules

segment.source: Delete an AppLocker rule
segment.target: Delete an AppLocker rule

segment.source: Add exceptions for an AppLocker rule
segment.target: Add exceptions for an AppLocker rule

segment.source: When finished, the policy is in effect.
segment.target: When finished, the policy is in effect.

segment.source: To make the same change on another device, you can use any of the following methods:
segment.target: To make the same change on another device, you can use any of the following methods:

segment.source: From the device that you made the change on, export the AppLocker policy, and then import the policy onto the other device.
segment.target: From the device that you made the change on, export the AppLocker policy, and then import the policy onto the other device.

segment.source: To do this, use the AppLocker Export Policy and Import Policy features to copy the rules from the changed computer.
segment.target: To do this, use the AppLocker Export Policy and Import Policy features to copy the rules from the changed computer.

segment.source: Caution: When importing rules from another computer, all the rules will be applied, not just the one that was updated.
segment.target: Caution: When importing rules from another computer, all the rules will be applied, not just the one that was updated.

segment.source: Merging policies allows both existing and updated (or new) rules to be applied.
segment.target: Merging policies allows both existing and updated (or new) rules to be applied.

segment.source: Merge AppLocker policies.
segment.target: Merge AppLocker policies.

segment.source: For procedures to do this, see Merge AppLocker policies manually and Merge AppLocker policies by using Set-ApplockerPolicy.
segment.target: For procedures to do this, see Merge AppLocker policies manually and Merge AppLocker policies by using Set-ApplockerPolicy.
